cards.body:
HTML includes metadata in head:
- author
- description
- keywords 

Page includes:
- Favicon

Page Topic:
- decide on a page topic that takes form as an app and can be expanded on in the future

Sufficient content for your app:
- 2-3 printed pages long
- 3-5+ images/videos)

HTML header and footer w/ appropriate information:
- title
- copyright)

Page has mock interactivity:
- button/form link
- second page that is changed content (reuses css from the homepage)

Use CSS to style the page:
- Use some custom CSS
- Use bootstrap

Specifics (using CSS or bootstrap)
- Set color
- Set fonts / sizes
- Specify margin / padding

Content is navigable/readable:
- everything is present

Includes some "non-default" layout:
- columns, grid, etc
- an absolutely positioned element

Semantic html usage
- Such as main, header, nav, etc.

Sectioning elements:
- appropriately structuring the page
- includes headings
- encouraging navigability

Alt text on images:
- alternative text for all images
- if necessary: captions, aria-labels
- other aria tags as necessary (e.g., for widgets)
All content visible/available on small & large screens
Specifies viewport meta for mobile devices

Follow mobile design principles:
- layout
- media presence
- navigation, etc

Layout is customized to different screen sizes:
- columns
- size adjustments, etc 
- should “look different:”
Uses alternate image resolutions for large images
Uses media queries (in meaningful ways)

Code takes mobile-first approach
- default is mobile
- CSS media rules change that

Polish and style:
- good/considered colors
- fonts
- spacing, etc

Engaging effects:
For example:
- box-shadow, border-radius, gradients, images
- detailed iconography (font-awesome)
- framework components (navbar, cards, wells, etc)

or advanced:
- parallax 
- useful transforms, animations

Code is valid
- doctype included
- passes linter
No unnecessary/redundant HTML elements
Informative CSS class/id names

Appropriate CSS selectors:
- prefer class over id
- avoid duplicated CSS rules/properties

Overall indentation/readability/organization:
- particularly CSS
- shared CSS files
Organizing comments if necessary (HTML & CSS)
Deployed to gh-pages
Tagged commit (to turn in)
